result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Kwame Stewart Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph Kwame Stewart in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by 11/14/2022. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 16.  Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Joseph Kwame Stewart in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Additional appearance made by Jon Josephsen on behalf of Patrick Franken.
Case in court for Motion Hearing. All parties appeared via zoom. Arguments heard.  Court placed on the record, findings of fact and legal analysis. For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIED defense's motion to dismiss. Case adjourned to Branch 16.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State Response to Motion to Dismiss

Defendant Joseph Kwame Stewart in court with Attorney Craig S. Powell via zoom.  Patricia Daugherty for Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  The scheduling conference was held OFF THE RECORD via zoom.  Defense filed a request for a motion hearing.  The court provided deadline for the state's filing a response by 6/15/22 end of business.   The court order the matter adjourned back to Branch 16 via zoom.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Email correspondence with parties. Case re-scheduled for Scheduling Conference on 04/28/2022. Court further informs defense counsel of 04/26/2022 deadline for filing any motions.
Received & Filed, PRELIMINARY HEARING of Original Transcript (15 pages) commencing 03-02-2022. by DANIELLE N. HOLCOMB.

Defendant Joseph Kwame Stewart in court with Attorney Craig S. Powell.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Daering.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (2/26/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Joseph Kwame Stewart in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Defense motion to DISMISS is DENIED. Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Hart called to inform the court that he could not appear on 2/23/2022 at 2:00. Case rescheduled to 2/24/2022, at 2:00 p.m.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/23/22 @ 2p
Defendant is out of custody and given a new court date.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
